description: Brandwatch VIZIA is a flexible, dynamic, multi-screen data visualization platform that brings social and marketing data to everyone in your business. Powered by Brandwatch Consumer Research data and key social and marketing integrations, it provides comprehensive overview of your marketing world with customizable displays that can be broadcast on any screen and controlled remotely.

user_flows.description: Complete workflow for setting up VIZIA platform and organizing content structure through folders and basic configuration
prerequisites: Access to Brandwatch Consumer Research (if creating BCR-based content)

steps.description: Set up folders to categorize different groups of data and content
details: Navigate to VIZIA platform
Click '+' button next to 'Folders' to create new folder
Name folder descriptively (e.g., by team, department, or data type)
Configure folder settings: locale, time zone, theme
Set content moderation filters if needed
Configure folder permissions for team access

steps.description: Set up access controls and content filtering for folders
details: Access folder management through 3-dots menu
Configure content moderation: Explicit images, Gore, Drugs filtering
Set permission levels for collaborators and viewers
Configure locale and time zone settings
Select appropriate theme (e.g., Brandwatch Dark)
Save folder configuration

steps.action: Plan content strategy and data sources
steps.description: Determine what data sources and visualizations will be needed
details: Identify available data sources (Brandwatch, Google Analytics, Facebook, etc.)
Plan deck themes and purposes
Determine which teams need access to which content
Consider screen deployment locations and audience needs
Plan folder organization strategy

options: Team-based: Separate folders for different departments
Content-type based: Folders by data source or visualization type
Project-based: Folders organized around specific initiatives
Hybrid approach: Combination of organizational methods
Open access: Most users have broad viewing permissions
Restricted access: Limited permissions based on role
Department-specific: Access aligned with organizational structure

outcomes: Organized folder structure for content management
Proper permissions and access controls established
Content moderation settings configured
Foundation ready for deck and slide creation
Team access properly configured

user_flows.description: Workflow for creating, organizing, and managing VIZIA decks as containers for data visualization slides
prerequisites: Access to data sources for visualizations

steps.description: Initialize a new deck container within a folder
details: Navigate to desired folder
Click '+ NEW DECK' button
Name the deck descriptively
Choose folder location (existing or create new)
Select creation option: 'CREATE & OPEN DECK' or 'CREATE DECK & VIEW IN FOLDER'

steps.description: Set up deck-level settings and organization
details: Access deck through content management interface
Preview deck content by clicking on deck (not title)
View slide count and component information
Set deck-level permissions if needed
Organize deck position within folder

steps.description: Handle deck operations throughout its lifecycle
details: Use 3-dots menu for deck operations:
Rename deck for clarity
Duplicate deck to same or different folder
Move deck between folders
Preview deck content and slides
Delete deck when no longer needed

steps.description: Manage multiple decks and their relationships
details: Use 'Recent Decks' for quick access to recently edited content
Star important decks for easy retrieval
Manage shared decks received from other users
Handle deleted decks (available for 90 days)
Drag and drop slides between decks

creation_options: Immediate editing vs. folder viewing options

options: Descriptive naming: Clear purpose and content indication
Date-based naming: Include creation or update dates
Project-based naming: Align with specific initiatives
Audience-based naming: Indicate intended viewers
Single-purpose decks: One deck per specific use case
Multi-purpose decks: Comprehensive dashboards
Template decks: Reusable deck structures

outcomes: Well-organized deck structure within folders
Clear deck naming and categorization
Efficient deck management workflow established
Foundation ready for slide and component addition
Deck lifecycle management processes in place

user_flows.description: Detailed workflow for creating slides, adding data visualization components, and configuring display settings

steps.action: Access Deck Editor and create slides
steps.description: Enter slide creation mode and add new slides
details: Open deck to access Deck Editor interface
Click '+' button on top left to add new slide
Name slide by triple-clicking 'Untitled Slide' title
View slide in left sidebar for organization
Drag and drop slides to reorder if needed

steps.description: Add data visualization components to slides
details: Click '+ Add Component' or 'ADD COMPONENT' button
Browse Component Picker by data source categories
Select appropriate component from available data sources:
- Brandwatch: Social media insights and analytics
- Google Analytics: Website performance data
- Salesforce: CRM and sales data
- Microsoft Excel: Spreadsheet data
- Hootsuite: Social media management data
Configure component settings and data connections

steps.description: Configure slide appearance and display settings
details: Use 'Slide Layout' option in Deck Editor
Arrange components within slide using drag and drop
Select layout options based on component count
Configure slide timing intervals:
- 30 seconds, 1 minute, 2 minutes, 3 minutes
- 4 minutes, 5 minutes, 10 minutes
Set individual timing for each slide as needed

steps.description: Handle slide lifecycle and organization
details: Access slide control options through component menu:
Rename slides for clarity
Duplicate slides for consistency
Delete slides when no longer needed
Configure time intervals for rotation
Test slide display and component functionality

slide_timing_options: 30 seconds - Quick rotation for overview displays
1-2 minutes - Standard rotation for most content

options: Single source focus: All components from one data source
Multi-source integration: Components from various sources
Audience-specific: Components chosen for specific viewers
Purpose-driven: Components aligned with specific objectives
Uniform timing: Same interval for all slides
Variable timing: Different intervals based on content complexity
Audience-based timing: Timing matched to viewing context

outcomes: Functional slides with data visualization components
Properly configured slide timing for display rotation
Well-organized slide structure within deck
Components connected to appropriate data sources
Slides ready for distribution and display

user_flows.description: Workflow for distributing VIZIA content to screens and managing display across multiple locations
prerequisites: Completed decks with slides and components
Chrome extension installed on target devices

steps.description: Navigate to content distribution interface
details: From Deck Editor, click 'Share' button
Select 'Cast to screen' option
Access Distribution Hub interface
View available installations and screens
Review current content deployment status

steps.description: Set up Chrome extension on display devices
details: Install Chrome extension on target devices
Ensure devices are connected to network
Open Chrome browser on display screens
Verify extension is active and connected
Test connection to Distribution Hub

steps.description: Distribute decks to specific screen installations
details: Select target installation from available list
Drag and drop deck onto desired screen
Monitor deployment status
Verify content appears on target screen
Test content rotation and component functionality

steps.description: Handle content updates and screen management
details: Monitor screen status through Distribution Hub
Update content by replacing decks
Manage multiple installations across organization
Handle offline installations and reconnection
Use 'Replace content on installation' for updates

deployment_methods: Cast to screen from Deck Editor

options: Centralized control: All screens managed from single hub
Distributed management: Local control of specific screens
Content-specific deployment: Different content for different locations
Scheduled updates: Regular content refresh cycles
Event-driven updates: Content changes based on business needs
Real-time updates: Continuous content evolution

outcomes: Content successfully deployed to target screens
Screen network established and managed
Real-time data visualization displays active
Content update and management processes established
Multi-location display capability operational

user_flows.description: Administrative workflow for managing user access, permissions, and team collaboration within VIZIA
prerequisites: Team member information for account creation

steps.description: Navigate to Brandwatch user administration
details: Go to my.brandwatch.com or accounts.brandwatch.com
Access account administration section
Navigate to user management interface
View current user list and access levels

steps.description: Add new team members to VIZIA platform
details: Click '+ New User' button
Enter required user information:
- Email address
- First name
- Last name
Select product access including VIZIA
Configure account administrator status if needed

steps.description: Set appropriate access levels and product permissions
details: Choose product access permissions:
- Audiences
- Consumer Research
- Qriously
- VIZIA (ensure this is selected)
Set user role level:
- Admin: Full control over everything in VIZIA account
- Member: Can create and edit folders and decks with limited access based on folder permissions

steps.description: Finalize user account creation and access
details: Review all user settings and permissions
Click 'Create' to complete user setup
User receives access to VIZIA account
If user has Consumer Research access, same credentials work for VIZIA
Configure folder permissions for specific access control

admin.description: Full control over everything in the VIZIA account
capabilities: View and edit all folders and decks

member.description: Can create and edit folders and decks but may have limited access to certain content depending on folder permissions
capabilities: Create and edit assigned folders and decks
Access content based on folder permissions
View and interact with permitted content

options: Minimal privilege: Start with Member role and upgrade as needed
Role-based assignment: Align roles with organizational responsibilities
Project-based access: Temporary elevated access for specific initiatives
Centralized control: Admin manages all permissions
Distributed management: Team leads manage their group access
Self-service model: Users request access as needed

outcomes: Team members have appropriate VIZIA access
User roles aligned with organizational responsibilities
Proper permission structure established
Folder-level access controls configured
User lifecycle management process in place

user_flows.description: Workflow for sharing VIZIA decks with external stakeholders and managing secure reporting distribution
prerequisites: Completed VIZIA decks ready for sharing
Understanding of data sensitivity and security requirements
Customer Success Manager contact for subscription setup

steps.description: Navigate to deck sharing options
details: Open deck to be shared
Click 'Share' button in top-right corner
Select 'Send to people' option
Access email sharing interface

steps.description: Set up email addresses and sharing message
details: Enter recipient email addresses:
- Input emails one by one, or
- Copy and paste list separated by commas or semicolons
Compose sharing message with context
Review recipient list for accuracy
Ensure external recipients have valid email addresses

steps.description: Send secure link and manage access
details: Click 'Share with 1 person' (or appropriate count) button
Recipients receive email with shared deck notification
Shared link is live for one year by default
Recipients can access deck without VIZIA login
Monitor sharing status and recipient engagement

steps.description: Handle shared link lifecycle and security
details: Monitor recipient access through Share by Email menu
View access statistics and engagement metrics:
- Number of people with access
- Total link clicks
- Individual view counts per recipient
Manage access: resend invites, remove recipients
Toggle 'Emailed links' to Off to revoke access if needed

security_measures: Device-specific access (link tied to recipient device)
recipient_experience: Request fresh link for new devices

sharing_limitations: Links work on one device per recipient
Cannot share to mailing lists (individual emails only)

options: Open sharing: Extended access for ongoing collaboration
Restricted sharing: Limited-time access for specific reviews
Monitored sharing: Regular review of access and usage
Individual management: Add/remove recipients as needed
Group-based sharing: Consistent recipient lists for regular reports
Project-specific sharing: Temporary access for specific initiatives

outcomes: External stakeholders have secure access to VIZIA content
Real-time data sharing without platform access requirements
Controlled and monitored external content distribution
Streamlined reporting workflow for stakeholders
Secure link management and access control

core_components: Folders: Organizational containers for content management
Decks: Collections of slides for specific display purposes
Slides: Individual screens containing 1-9 data visualization components
Components: Data visualizations from various integrated sources

key_features: Real-time data integration from multiple sources
Secure external sharing without platform access requirements
Centralized distribution hub for screen management
Automated slide rotation with customizable timing
Live data updates with stakeholder access tracking
limitations: Chrome extension required for screen displays
External sharing limited to individual email addresses (no mailing lists)
Shared links tied to specific devices for security
One-year maximum lifetime for shared links
Network connectivity required for real-time updates
integration_capabilities: Social media platform integrations (Facebook, Instagram, Hootsuite)
Custom data source integration via URL
Real-time API connections for live data
